entry.title: 2025 Nationals embargo effective
entry.summary: Everyone intending to enter Nationals 2025 needs to be aware of the embargoes in place for the event. Embargoes are areas that are out of bounds to competitors prior to the events, and cover the areas used in the competition. This prevents unfair prior knowledge being gained about the terrain and map features, and helps […] 2025 Nationals embargo effective first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: CX80 MTBO World Cup: Splittorff and Haga take top places; Team World Cup to Finland
entry.summary: Dane Nikoline Splittorff finished strongly with a 60-point lead in the women’s World Cup, and Finnish rider André Haga ended 52 points ahead in the men’s, thanks largely to a good first half of the season. This is Splittorff’s third overall victory in successive years; Haga was fifth last year and seventh in 2022. Through […]

entry.title: CX80 WMTBOC: Denmark and Czechia take Relay titles
entry.summary: Denmark dominated the women’s race throughout, winning by almost 5 minutes, whilst Czechia’s men retained their title from 2023 with victory by just 16 seconds in dull and damp conditions near Shumen, Bulgaria today. Cæcilie Christoffersen started strongly for Denmark in the women’s race and was 1.28 in the lead at the first changeover. At […]

entry.title: CX80 WMTBOC Long race: defending champions both win; 3 medals to Denmark
entry.summary: Nikoline Splittorff, Denmark and Vojtech Ludvik, Czechia successfully defended their Long Distance titles in a demanding race in hilly Bulgarian terrain today. Ludvik finished with a 1.54 lead and Splittorff won by 20 seconds. The very experienced Czech rider Martina Tichovska was best in the early stages, and passed the 8.6 km point in the […]

entry.title: North American O champs | Ontario, Canada
entry.summary: At the beginning of August, Gene and I competed in the Canadian Orienteering Championships and North American Orienteering Championships. These were held in Ontario, Canada, and consisted of a middle and long distance race at Mansfield (Canadian Championships); a sprint, sprint relay and knockout sprint in Kingston (North American Championships); and a middle and long […] North American O champs | Ontario, Canada first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: World University Champs | Bankso, Bulgaria | 1-6 July
entry.summary: WUOC was a fun-spirited event designed for university students, but the competition was very fierce, with a large number of WOC-level runners. The team felt it was refreshing to race against athletes who were also students, as opposed to the full-time professionals seen in the World Cup and WOC. Unfortunately, some team members faced illness and […] World University Champs | Bankso, Bulgaria | 1-6 July first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Oceania 2025 | Entries open! Plan your trip
entry.summary: The warm-up events on the 18th and 19th are just outside New Plymouth, Taranaki, which is about half-way between Auckland and Wellington. Driving time is approximately 4.5 hours from either end, and domestic flights to New Plymouth airport take about one hour. After you’ve warmed up on Taranaki’s middle and long distance, it’s another 3 hours’ […] Oceania 2025 | Entries open! Plan your trip first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: NZ MTBO champs 2025 | 1&2 February | Otago
entry.summary: Bring your bike and allow time arrive in the South Island way before Nationals because the MTBO nationals is planned for the first weekend in February 2o25. The format will roughly be: Alexandra for the middle, the sprint on Saturday, at Naseby for long on Sunday and a Rogaine on Monday. NZ MTBO champs 2025 | 1&2 February | Otago first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: South Island Secondary School Champs | Friday 25 & Saturday 26 April 2025
entry.summary: Advanced notice for the dates and location of the 2025 South Island Secondary schools. The sprint event will be in Cromwell and the long distance in Alexandra. For more information contact Dunedin Orienteering South Island Secondary School Champs | Friday 25 & Saturday 26 April 2025 first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Jakob’s journey aligns with acceleration of the sport
entry.summary: The protégé effect is a learning phenomenon where teaching and preparing to teach information to others helps a person learn that information. Jakob has fast tracked his knowledge of orienteering super-fast by growing his knowledge as he introduces the sport to others in the community. Jakob Abernethy began orienteering three years ago in Year 8, inspired by […] Jakob’s journey aligns with acceleration of the sport first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: 2024 Manawatū Schools’ Relay Champs report
entry.summary: On August 2nd, the Red Kiwi Orienteering Club hosted the second Manawatū Schools’ Relay Championships. This year, we saw participation from 246 students across 25 schools, marking an increase of 60 students and 6 new schools from last year. Leading up to the event, club members visited interested schools to teach orienteering skills through classroom […] 2024 Manawatū Schools’ Relay Champs report first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Euro MTBO | Bike fitness and mental agility required
entry.summary: Orienteering is known to enhance brain health and longevity. Rob Garden tested the new knee by pushing hard on the pedals during the Masters MTBO. entry.title: Autopilot | MTBO NZ mapboard importer
entry.summary: Did you know that we have a small importer of Autopilot mapboards in NZ . Andrew McNeill is based in Taranaki, and has limited stock but always replaces what he sells. He simply met the manufacturer in Prague, Czech and got on well and offered to bring some boards to NZ. entry.summary: he September edition of The Australian Orienteer magazine is in press, and is available online.
